Derek James wrote:

>On Thu, 19 Aug 2004 22:05:44 +0100, Colin Green <cgreen@...> wrote:
>  
>
>>Yes the parameters are all correct and I agree that it seems counter
>>intuitive. Actually I think you answered this question yourself in your
>>response to John -  crossover. 
>>    
>>
>
>Well, this still doesn't make sense to me.  How are you handling
>crossover?  ANJI works as the original NEAT paper described--when two
>individuals mate, the topology of the fitter individual is used, while
>weight values for common connections have a 50/50 chance of coming
>from either parent.
>  
>
As far as I can remember this is what SharpNEAT is doing - taking all of 
the excess and disjoint genes from the fittest parent. However, (wait 
for it) I just had a quick look at the code and it /looks/ like it might 
actually be taking excess and disjoint genes from *both* parents. I'll 
have to investigate further 'cause that bit of code is a bit fidly and 
requires a clear head to debug, but it seems that your suspicions may be 
well founded!

This could well be the source of the ongoing disagreements about bloat, 
and how much of a problem it is.

Colin
